ku Ivai tiruvōṟṟiyūr piccaṉ Eḻuttu
Ip-paṭikku Ivai kōyil nāyakam paṭampakka-nāyaka-paṭṭaṉ Eḻuttu

Hereditary rights of land kāṇi from northern Perumpākam as tēvatāṉam for the god that gracefully dwells there so that he hears the Śrīpurāṇam by Āḷuṭaiya-nampi after he gracefully recited it in the assembly hall tiruvōlakkam that lies next kiṭa to the holy Makiḻ tree in the shrine the god Paṭampakka-nāyaka. This was done on the day of the ninth star Āyilēyam, which occurs on the Wednesday of Ekātāci,that is, the sixth day of the holy festival of Paṅkūṉi for the Lord . accountant of the temple; Paṭampakka-nāyakka, head nāyakam of the temple; Tiruvōṟṟiyūr-Piccaṉ; Piṭāraṉ, an official piṭār from Ceyaṅkoṇṭacōḻa-maṇṭala; the scholar paṇṭitaṉ Vāgīśvara, teacher of the Cōmacittāntam Somasiddhānta, the Ariyapiraṉ-paṭṭaṉ, manager of the temple mutt, ṭāṉ śrīmāhe Paṇṭitaṉ alias Caturāṉ, belonging to the monastery in the temple of the Lord Tiruvōṟṟiyūr-uṭaiyār, in the area of Puḻal within the Aiyaṅkoṇṭacōḻa-maṇṭalam.
